headline: Netflix enters exclusive talks to acquire Warner Bros Discovery studio and streaming service, Bloomberg News reporter says
summary: Netflix has entered ‌exclusive talks with Warner Bros Discovery to acquire ⁠its studio ‌and streaming service, a Bloomberg ‍News reporter said in a post ​on X. Netflix has ‌emerged as the top bidder for Warner Bros Discovery, Reuters reported ⁠on Thursday, ​raising the ​stakes in a potential deal that ‍could ⁠reshape the media landscape.

summary: Netflix’s most recent offer, submitted on Thursday, valued the Warner Bros. studio, HBO Max streaming service and related parts of the company at around $28 per share, sources said.

content.summary: Netflix’s most recent offer, submitted on Thursday, valued the Warner Bros. studio, HBO Max streaming service and related parts of the company at around $28 per share, sources said.

headline: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

content.title: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
content.summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

headline: NETFLIX TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. FOLLOWING THE SEPARATION OF DISCOVERY GLOBAL FOR A TOTAL ENTERPRISE VALUE OF $82.7 BILLION (Equity Value of $72.0 Billion)
summary: Today, Netflix, Inc. (the Company) and Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (WBD) announced they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Netflix will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.

content.title: NETFLIX TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. FOLLOWING THE SEPARATION OF DISCOVERY GLOBAL FOR A TOTAL ENTERPRISE VALUE OF $82.7 BILLION (Equity Value of $72.0 Billion)
content.summary: Today, Netflix, Inc. (the Company) and Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (WBD) announced they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Netflix will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.

headline: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  It had been reported that the US streaming giant was in exclusive talks over the deal following a bidding war for the assets.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors.

content.title: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
content.summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  It had been reported that the US streaming giant was in exclusive talks over the deal following a bidding war for the assets.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors.

headline: Netflix Lines Up $59 Billion of Debt for Warner Bros. Deal
summary: Wells Fargo & Co., BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Plc are providing the unsecured bridge loan, according to a statement Friday, a type of financing that is typically replaced with more permanent debt such as corporate bonds.  Under the deal announced Friday, Warner Bros. shareholders will receive $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix.

content.title: Netflix Lines Up $59 Billion of Debt for Warner Bros. Deal
content.summary: Wells Fargo & Co., BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Plc are providing the unsecured bridge loan, according to a statement Friday, a type of financing that is typically replaced with more permanent debt such as corporate bonds.  Under the deal announced Friday, Warner Bros. shareholders will receive $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix.

headline: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery in $82.7 billion deal
summary: Investing.com -- Netflix has agreed to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery in a cash and stock transaction valued at $27.75 per share, with a total enterprise value of approximately $82.7 billion.

content.title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery in $82.7 billion deal

headline: Netflix says its reached deal to buy Warner Bros.
summary: Netflix (NFLX) has won the dramatic bidding war for parts of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $27.75 per share. The total enterprise value of the deal is $82.7B. The deal is for Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service, HBO Max. The company will still spin out its TV networks, which includes TNT and CNN. Netflix came out on top -- beating out Paramount (PSKY) and Comcast (CMCSA). For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance. Editor's note: The headline on this post has been updated to reflect what Netflix is acquiring.

content.title: Netflix says its reached deal to buy Warner Bros.
content.description:
Netflix (NFLX) has won the dramatic bidding war for parts of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $27.75 per share. The total enterprise value of the deal is $82.7B. The deal is for Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service, HBO Max. The company will still spin out its TV networks, which includes TNT and CNN. Netflix came out on top -- beating out Paramount (PSKY) and Comcast (CMCSA).

For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

Editor's note: The headline on this post has been updated to reflect what Netflix is acquiring.
content.summary: Netflix (NFLX) has won the dramatic bidding war for parts of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $27.75 per share. The total enterprise value of the deal is $82.7B. The deal is for Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service, HBO Max. The company will still spin out its TV networks, which includes TNT and CNN. Netflix came out on top -- beating out Paramount (PSKY) and Comcast (CMCSA). For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance. Editor's note: The headline on this post has been updated to reflect what Netflix is acquiring.

headline: Instant View: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises, including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry ​Potter", will further tilt the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.

content.title: Instant View: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
content.summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises, including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry ​Potter", will further tilt the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.

headline: Paramount questions ‘fairness’ of Warner Bros. sale process, CNBC says
summary: Paramount Skydance (PSKY) is questioning the fairness of Warner Bros. Discovery’s (WBD) sale process and whether the company is acting in the best interest of shareholders, Julia Boorstin, Lillian Rizzo and Alex Sherman of CNBC report, citing a letter reviewed by CNBC. Paramount attorneys told Warner CEO David Zaslav that Paramount was questioning the “fairness and adequacy” of the sale process, CNBC reports. Paramount’s letter calls out reports that Warner management appears to favor Netflix’s

headline: Netflix Buying Warner: What You Need to Know
summary: Netflix is paying $72 billion, or $27.75 for each Warner Bros. Discovery share.  If I own Warner Bros. stock, what happens now?  The deal needs approval from by regulators and target company shareholders, while Warner Bros. also plans to split off its cable division into a publicly traded company.

content.title: Netflix Buying Warner: What You Need to Know
content.summary: Netflix is paying $72 billion, or $27.75 for each Warner Bros. Discovery share.  If I own Warner Bros. stock, what happens now?  The deal needs approval from by regulators and target company shareholders, while Warner Bros. also plans to split off its cable division into a publicly traded company.

headline: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros., more executive departures at Apple
summary: Morning Brief anchor Julie Hyman breaks down the latest market news for December 5, 2025. Netflix (NFLX) announced it is buying Warner Bros. Discovery's (WBD) studios and streaming unit in a deal valued at nearly $83 billion. Citi media and entertainment senior analyst Jason Bazinet shares his take on the deal. Meanwhile, more top executives are leaving Apple (AAPL). Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley helps make sense of the latest departures.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Netflix (NFLX) announced it is buying Warner Bros. Discovery's (WBD) studios and streaming unit in a deal valued at nearly $83 billion. Citi media and entertainment senior analyst Jason Bazinet shares his take on the deal.

Meanwhile, more top executives are leaving Apple (AAPL). Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley helps make sense of the latest departures. 

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Netflix Agrees to Buy Warner Bros. in Deal Worth $72 Billion
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a deal that reshapes Hollywood and streaming. Warner Bros. shareholders will get $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix. The total equity value of the deal is $72 billion. Geetha Ranganathan of Bloomberg Intelligence has more.

content.title: Netflix Agrees to Buy Warner Bros. in Deal Worth $72 Billion
content.description: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a deal that reshapes Hollywood and streaming. Warner Bros. shareholders will get $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix. The total equity value of the deal is $72 billion. Geetha Ranganathan of Bloomberg Intelligence has more.

The total equity value of the deal is $72 billion. Geetha Ranganathan of Bloomberg Intelligence has more.

headline: How Netflix’s $72B Warner Bros. deal changes the streaming calculus
summary: A combined entity could generate U.S. ad revenue of roughly $2.3 billion and command 10% of total TV viewing, per analyst estimates.
